data.event: The municipality was founded in 1767 by Father Alejandro Vidal, a Dominican priest who led a Spanish mission.
In 1768, it was called "Lungabang", which means "cave" in the Gaddang dialect.
In 1851, Governor General Antonio Urbiztondo declared Lumabang a barrio of Bayombong for not having sufficient inhabitants and revenue to maintain itself.
In 1853, the first Ilocanos arrived brought by Don Diego Lumicao, former Gobernadorcillo.
In 1889, it was renamed Solano, in honor of Governor General Ramon Solano y Llanderal.

event.title: 1957, the barrios of Ibung and Bintawan were separated

data.event: In 1957, the barrios of Ibung and Bintawan were separated to form the town of Ibung, later renamed as Villaverde.
